Protocols/UserProfileDelegate.html#/s:11.name: update(userProfile:from:)
Protocols/UserProfileDelegate.html#/s:11.abstract: Updates the UserProfile instance from the data received from an identity provider.

Protocols/TypeSafeCredentials.html#/s:11.name: id
Protocols/TypeSafeCredentials.html#/s:11.abstract: An identifier that uniquely identifies a user within the context of an authentication provider.

Protocols/TypeSafeCredentials.html#/s:11.name: authenticate(request:response:onSuccess:onFailure:onSkip:)
Protocols/TypeSafeCredentials.html#/s:11.abstract: Authenticate an incoming request. On success, an instance of Self is returned. On failure, the HTTPStatusCode and any response headers to be set are returned. On skip (Meaning the plugin didn’t recognize the authentication header), the HTTPStatusCode and any response headers to be set are returned.

Protocols/TypeSafeCredentials.html#/s:11.name: handle(request:response:completion:)
Protocols/TypeSafeCredentials.html#/s:11.abstract: Static function that attempts to create an instance of Self by calling authenticate. On success, this Self instance is returned so it can be used by a TypeSafeMiddleware route. On failure, an unauthorized response is sent immediately. If the authentication header isn’t recognised, RequestError.unauthorized is returned to the TypeSafeMiddleware route. This means the current route will not be invoked but other routes can still be matched.

Protocols/TypeSafeMultiCredentials.html#.name: authenticationMethods
Protocols/TypeSafeMultiCredentials.html#.abstract: An array of authentication types that conform to TypeSafeCredentials. The authenticate function for each type will be called in order and, on successfully authenticating, will call init using the TypeSafeCredentials instance.

Protocols/TypeSafeMultiCredentials.html#.name: init(successfulAuth:)
Protocols/TypeSafeMultiCredentials.html#.abstract: This initalizer creates an instance of the type conforming to TypeSafeMultiCredentials from a successfully authenticated TypeSafeCredentials instance.

Protocols/TypeSafeMultiCredentials.html#.name: authenticate(request:response:onSuccess:onFailure:onSkip:)
Protocols/TypeSafeMultiCredentials.html#.abstract: Static function that attempts to create an instance of Self by iterating through an array TypeSafeCredentials types and calling authenticate. On a successful authentication, an instance of Self is initialized from the TypeSafeCredentials instance and returned so it can be used by a TypeSafeMiddleware route. On a failed authentication, an unauthorized response is sent immediately. If the authentication header isn’t recognised, authenticate is called on the next TypeSafeCredentials type.

Protocols/CredentialsPluginProtocol.html.name: redirecting
Protocols/CredentialsPluginProtocol.html.abstract: An indication as to whether the plugin is redirecting or not.

Protocols/CredentialsPluginProtocol.html.name: CredentialsPluginProtocol
Protocols/CredentialsPluginProtocol.html.abstract: The protocol that defines the API for Credentials plugins for authentication of

Protocols/TypeSafeMultiCredentials.html.name: TypeSafeMultiCredentials
Protocols/TypeSafeMultiCredentials.html.abstract: A TypeSafeMiddleware for authenticating users using multiple authentication methods. A type conforming to TypeSafeMultiCredentials must implement a static array of TypeSafeCredentials types and an initializer, which takes a TypeSafeCredentials instance. The route will attempt to authenticate by iterating through this array of TypeSafeCredentials until an authentication succeeds. This returns an instance of the succesful TypeSafeCredentials which is used to initialize the TypeSafeMultiCredentials instance. If a plugin fails or you reach then end of your TypeSafeCredentials array an unauthorized response is sent. The type conforming to TypeSafeMultiCredentials can then be used as a middleware in codable routes.

Protocols/TypeSafeCredentials.html.name: TypeSafeCredentials
Protocols/TypeSafeCredentials.html.abstract: A TypeSafeMiddleware for authenticating users. This protocol is implemented by plugins that identify the user using information supplied by the RouterRequest. The plugin must implement a static authenticate function which returns an instance of Self on success. This instance defines the name of the authentication provider (e.g. HTTPBasic), and an id that uniquely identifies a user for that provider.

Extensions/RouterRequest.html.name: RouterRequest
Extensions/RouterRequest.html.abstract: Extension of the RouterRequest class to provide access to UserProfile

Classes/UserProfile/UserProfileEmail.htm.name: type
Classes/UserProfile/UserProfileEmail.htm.abstract: The type of email address (home, work, etc.).

Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:11Credential.name: provider
Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:11Credential.abstract: The authenticating service used to authenticate the user.

Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:11Credential.name: displayName
Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:11Credential.abstract: The user’s name the way it should be displayed.

Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:11Credential.name: emails
Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:11Credential.abstract: An optional array of the user’s email addresses.

Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:11Credential.name: photos
Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:11Credential.abstract: An optional array of the user’s photos.

Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:11Credential.name: extendedProperties
Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:11Credential.abstract: A dictionary of additional properties. The values have to be serializable.

Classes/Credentials.html#/s:11Credential.name: options
Classes/Credentials.html#/s:11Credential.abstract: The dictionary of options to pass to the plugins.

Classes/Credentials.html#/s:11Credential.name: handle(request:response:next:)
Classes/Credentials.html#/s:11Credential.abstract: Handle an incoming request: authenticate the request using the registered plugins.

Classes/Credentials.html#/s:11Credential.name: getRedirectingReturnTo(for:)
Classes/Credentials.html#/s:11Credential.abstract: Get the URL to which the flow will return to after successfully authenticating using a redirecting plugin.

Classes/Credentials.html#/s:11Credential.name: setRedirectingReturnTo(_:for:)
Classes/Credentials.html#/s:11Credential.abstract: Set the URL to which the flow will return to after successfully authenticating using a redirecting plugin.

Classes/Credentials.html#/s:11Credential.name: authenticate(credentialsType:successRedirect:failureRedirect:)
Classes/Credentials.html#/s:11Credential.abstract: Create a RouterHandler that invokes the specific redirecting plugin to authenticate incoming requests.

Classes/Credentials.html#/s:11Credential.name: logOut(request:)
Classes/Credentials.html#/s:11Credential.abstract: Delete the user profile information from the session and the request.

Classes/BaseCacheElement.html.name: BaseCacheElement
Classes/BaseCacheElement.html.abstract: The cache element for keeping user profile information.

Classes/Credentials.html.name: Credentials
Classes/Credentials.html.abstract: A pluggable framework for validating user credentials.

Classes/UserProfile.html.name: UserProfile
Classes/UserProfile.html.abstract: The user’s profile information. Different authentication services provide
